channel.title: NPCs give points
channel.description: How would I make it so that when someone kills a certain NPC they would get dungeoneering points

item.title: NPCs give points
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

cammyPVPftw:

Make sure its in you processes to auto update. This is located in client.java

No. Never dump things in process.

Add the sendframe to your appendDungeonExp at the bottom where you add the points and such.
The sendFrame will be in initialize() in client.java

Read full topic

Make sure its in you processes to auto update. This is located in client.java

item.title: NPCs give points
item.dc:creator: @lol_space1 lol space
item.description:
@lol_space1 wrote:

Is works. It just doesn’t automatically refresh the dung points. You have to relog.

Read full topic

item.title: NPCs give points
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“lol space, post:11, topic:537073”]I got it somewhat to work. When you kill the NPC is says that you killed it and you gain points.
But you don’t actually get the points

c.dungPoints doesn’t work? [/quote]
That’s all up to you and what you did…
c.dungPoints += pointsToAdd; Works perfectly.

Read full topic

item.title: NPCs give points
item.dc:creator: @lol_space1 lol space
item.description:
@lol_space1 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:537073”]Look at your code, dude, it’s not hard…

      public void appendSlayerExperience(int i) {
		int npc = 0;
		Client c = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[npcs[i].killedBy];
		if(c != null) {
			if (c.slayerTask == npcs[i].npcType ){
				c.taskAmount--;
				c.getPA().addSkillXP(npcs[i].MaxHP * Config.SLAYER_EXPERIENCE, 18);
				if (c.taskAmount <= 0 ) {
				if (npcs[i].npcType == 1645 || npcs[i].npcType == 1591 || npcs[i].npcType == 1618 || npcs[i].npcType == 1643 || npcs[i].npcType == 941 || npcs[i].npcType == 119 || npcs[i].npcType == 82 || npcs[i].npcType == 52 || npcs[i].npcType == 1612 || npcs[i].npcType == 117 || npcs[i].npcType == 1265 || npcs[i].npcType == 112 || npcs[i].npcType == 125) {
					c.getPA().addSkillXP((npcs[i].MaxHP * 10) * Config.SLAYER_EXPERIENCE, 18);
					c.SPoints += 10;
					c.slayerTask = -1;
					c.sendMessage("You completed your MEDIUM slayer task. Please see a slayer master to get a new one.");
					c.sendMessage("You receive 10 Slayer Points.");
				}

There’s your code. Now take it, copy it, and change the name.

public void appendDungeonExp(int npcid) { int npc = 0; Client c = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[npcs[i].killedBy]; if(c != null) { if (c.slayerTask == npcs[i].npcType ){ c.taskAmount--; c.getPA().addSkillXP(npcs[i].MaxHP * Config.SLAYER_EXPERIENCE, 18); if (c.taskAmount <= 0 ) { if (npcs[i].npcType == 1645 || npcs[i].npcType == 1591 || npcs[i].npcType == 1618 || npcs[i].npcType == 1643 || npcs[i].npcType == 941 || npcs[i].npcType == 119 || npcs[i].npcType == 82 || npcs[i].npcType == 52 || npcs[i].npcType == 1612 || npcs[i].npcType == 117 || npcs[i].npcType == 1265 || npcs[i].npcType == 112 || npcs[i].npcType == 125) { c.getPA().addSkillXP((npcs[i].MaxHP * 10) * Config.SLAYER_EXPERIENCE, 18); c.SPoints += 10; c.slayerTask = -1; c.sendMessage("You completed your MEDIUM slayer task. Please see a slayer master to get a new one."); c.sendMessage("You receive 10 Slayer Points."); }
Now, remove the parts related to slayer.

[code=java]
public void appendDungeonExp(int npcid) {
Client c = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[npcs[i].killedBy];
if(c != null) {

}

}[/code]

Now we have something to work with. I don’t like how your slayer system was done so we’re doing this a different way.

Lets add in a switch statement, for each of the npc id’s that you want reward-able.

[code=java]
public void appendDungeonExp(int npcId) {
int pointsToAdd = 0;
int expToAdd = 0;
String npcName = null;
Client c = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[npcs[i].killedBy];

if(c != null) {
	swtich(npcId){

	}
	if(pointsToAdd > 0){
		c.dungPoints += pointsToAdd;
		c.getPA().addSkillXP(expToAdd * Config.DUNGEONEERING_EXPERIENCE, 18);//18 IS NOT the skill ID for dunggeoneering, so you're going to want to change that...
		c.sendMessage("You have defeated a "+npcName+"! You have been awarded Dung points for your efforts.");
		c.sendMessage("You receive "+pointsToAdd+" Dungeoneering Points.");
}

}[/code]

Now lets add in a npc. I’m going to add 101, which is a level 5 goblin, just for example.

[code=java]public void appendDungeonExp(int npcId) {

int pointsToAdd = 0;
int expToAdd = 0;
String npcName = null;
Client c = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[npcs[i].killedBy];

if(c != null) {
	swtich(npcId){
		case 101:
			pointsToAdd = 5;
			expToAdd = 10;
			npcName = "Goblin";
			break;
	}
	if(pointsToAdd > 0){
		c.dungPoints += pointsToAdd;
		c.getPA().addSkillXP(expToAdd * Config.DUNGEONEERING_EXPERIENCE, 18);//18 IS NOT the skill ID for dunggeoneering, so you're going to want to change that...
		c.sendMessage("You have defeated a "+npcName+"! You have been awarded Dung points for your efforts.");
		c.sendMessage("You receive "+pointsToAdd+" Dungeoneering Points.");
	}
}

}[/code]

I hope now you understand a bit of what I did…

Note: this all should work assuming you have DUNGEONEERING_EXPERIENCE in Config.java and you change the 18 to the correct skill id.[/quote]
Did what you said.
.
This is what happened

Read full topic

item.title: NPCs give points
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Look at your code, dude, it’s not hard…

      public void appendSlayerExperience(int i) {
		int npc = 0;
		Client c = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[npcs[i].killedBy];
		if(c != null) {
			if (c.slayerTask == npcs[i].npcType ){
				c.taskAmount--;
				c.getPA().addSkillXP(npcs[i].MaxHP * Config.SLAYER_EXPERIENCE, 18);
				if (c.taskAmount <= 0 ) {
				if (npcs[i].npcType == 1645 || npcs[i].npcType == 1591 || npcs[i].npcType == 1618 || npcs[i].npcType == 1643 || npcs[i].npcType == 941 || npcs[i].npcType == 119 || npcs[i].npcType == 82 || npcs[i].npcType == 52 || npcs[i].npcType == 1612 || npcs[i].npcType == 117 || npcs[i].npcType == 1265 || npcs[i].npcType == 112 || npcs[i].npcType == 125) {
					c.getPA().addSkillXP((npcs[i].MaxHP * 10) * Config.SLAYER_EXPERIENCE, 18);
					c.SPoints += 10;
					c.slayerTask = -1;
					c.sendMessage("You completed your MEDIUM slayer task. Please see a slayer master to get a new one.");
					c.sendMessage("You receive 10 Slayer Points.");
				}

There’s your code. Now take it, copy it, and change the name.

public void appendDungeonExp(int npcid) { int npc = 0; Client c = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[npcs[i].killedBy]; if(c != null) { if (c.slayerTask == npcs[i].npcType ){ c.taskAmount--; c.getPA().addSkillXP(npcs[i].MaxHP * Config.SLAYER_EXPERIENCE, 18); if (c.taskAmount <= 0 ) { if (npcs[i].npcType == 1645 || npcs[i].npcType == 1591 || npcs[i].npcType == 1618 || npcs[i].npcType == 1643 || npcs[i].npcType == 941 || npcs[i].npcType == 119 || npcs[i].npcType == 82 || npcs[i].npcType == 52 || npcs[i].npcType == 1612 || npcs[i].npcType == 117 || npcs[i].npcType == 1265 || npcs[i].npcType == 112 || npcs[i].npcType == 125) { c.getPA().addSkillXP((npcs[i].MaxHP * 10) * Config.SLAYER_EXPERIENCE, 18); c.SPoints += 10; c.slayerTask = -1; c.sendMessage("You completed your MEDIUM slayer task. Please see a slayer master to get a new one."); c.sendMessage("You receive 10 Slayer Points."); }
Now, remove the parts related to slayer.

[code=java]
public void appendDungeonExp(int npcid) {
Client c = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[npcs[i].killedBy];
if(c != null) {

}

}[/code]

Now we have something to work with. I don’t like how your slayer system was done so we’re doing this a different way.

Lets add in a switch statement, for each of the npc id’s that you want reward-able.

[code=java]
public void appendDungeonExp(int npcId) {
int pointsToAdd = 0;
int expToAdd = 0;
String npcName = null;
Client c = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[npcs[i].killedBy];

if(c != null) {
	swtich(npcId){

	}
	if(pointsToAdd > 0){
		c.dungPoints += pointsToAdd;
		c.getPA().addSkillXP(expToAdd * Config.DUNGEONEERING_EXPERIENCE, 18);//18 IS NOT the skill ID for dunggeoneering, so you're going to want to change that...
		c.sendMessage("You have defeated a "+npcName+"! You have been awarded Dung points for your efforts.");
		c.sendMessage("You receive "+pointsToAdd+" Dungeoneering Points.");
}

}[/code]

Now lets add in a npc. I’m going to add 101, which is a level 5 goblin, just for example.

[code=java]public void appendDungeonExp(int npcId) {

int pointsToAdd = 0;
int expToAdd = 0;
String npcName = null;
Client c = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[npcs[i].killedBy];

if(c != null) {
	swtich(npcId){
		case 101:
			pointsToAdd = 5;
			expToAdd = 10;
			npcName = "Goblin";
			break;
	}
	if(pointsToAdd > 0){
		c.dungPoints += pointsToAdd;
		c.getPA().addSkillXP(expToAdd * Config.DUNGEONEERING_EXPERIENCE, 18);//18 IS NOT the skill ID for dunggeoneering, so you're going to want to change that...
		c.sendMessage("You have defeated a "+npcName+"! You have been awarded Dung points for your efforts.");
		c.sendMessage("You receive "+pointsToAdd+" Dungeoneering Points.");
	}
}

}[/code]

I hope now you understand a bit of what I did…

Note: this all should work assuming you have DUNGEONEERING_EXPERIENCE in Config.java and you change the 18 to the correct skill id.

Read full topic

item.title: NPCs give points
item.dc:creator: @lol_space1 lol space
item.description:
@lol_space1 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:537073”][quote author=lol space link=topic=655888.msg4390008#msg4390008 date=1387130121]

Okay, I didn’t say to use the appendSlayerExperience method.
I said to mimic how other deaths are handled in process of npcHandler, and apply it to the npc you want and add points like you want.

			if (npcs[i].npcType == 10547) {
				c.getPA().addSkillXP((npcs[i].MaxHP * 12) * Config.DUNGEONEERING_EXPERIENCE, 18);
				c.dungPoints += 10;
				c.sendMessage("You have defeated a Primal Warrior! You have been awarded Dung points for your efforts.");
				c.sendMessage("You receive 10 Dungeoneering Points.");

Thats what I changed, I don’t know if its right. help?

[/quote]
You don’t want to put that into your appendSlayerExperience because that is supposed to handle only slayer.
Create another method similar to it but make it for dungeoneering.[/quote]
How do I do this? Help please

Read full topic

item.title: NPCs give points
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“lol space, post:5, topic:537073”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=655888.msg4390007#msg4390007 date=1387130080]
Okay, I didn’t say to use the appendSlayerExperience method.
I said to mimic how other deaths are handled in process of npcHandler, and apply it to the npc you want and add points like you want.
[/quote]

			if (npcs[i].npcType == 10547) {
				c.getPA().addSkillXP((npcs[i].MaxHP * 12) * Config.DUNGEONEERING_EXPERIENCE, 18);
				c.dungPoints += 10;
				c.sendMessage("You have defeated a Primal Warrior! You have been awarded Dung points for your efforts.");
				c.sendMessage("You receive 10 Dungeoneering Points.");

Thats what I changed, I don’t know if its right. help?[/quote]
You don’t want to put that into your appendSlayerExperience because that is supposed to handle only slayer.
Create another method similar to it but make it for dungeoneering.

Read full topic

item.title: NPCs give points
item.dc:creator: @lol_space1 lol space
item.description:
@lol_space1 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:537073”]In the npchandler’s process find the part that handles the npc death (should have like appendSlayerPoints(i) or similar in it).
Mimic how other npc’s death’s are handled and add points for the specific npc.[/quote]
[spoiler]
public void appendSlayerExperience(int i) {
int npc = 0;
Client c = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[npcs[i].killedBy];
if(c != null) {
if (c.slayerTask == npcs[i].npcType ){
c.taskAmount–;
c.getPA().addSkillXP(npcs[i].MaxHP * Config.SLAYER_EXPERIENCE, 18);
if (c.taskAmount <= 0 ) {
if (npcs[i].npcType == 1645 || npcs[i].npcType == 1591 || npcs[i].npcType == 1618 || npcs[i].npcType == 1643 || npcs[i].npcType == 941 || npcs[i].npcType == 119 || npcs[i].npcType == 82 || npcs[i].npcType == 52 || npcs[i].npcType == 1612 || npcs[i].npcType == 117 || npcs[i].npcType == 1265 || npcs[i].npcType == 112 || npcs[i].npcType == 125) {
c.getPA().addSkillXP((npcs[i].MaxHP * 10) * Config.SLAYER_EXPERIENCE, 18);
c.SPoints += 10;
c.slayerTask = -1;
c.sendMessage(“You completed your MEDIUM slayer task. Please see a slayer master to get a new one.”);
c.sendMessage(“You receive 10 Slayer Points.”);
}[/spoiler]
Thats what I found. how would I change to to primal warriors and dung points per kill ? and dung exp?

Read full topic

item.title: NPCs give points
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

In the npchandler’s process find the part that handles the npc death (should have like appendSlayerPoints(i) or similar in it).
Mimic how other npc’s death’s are handled and add points for the specific npc.

Read full topic
